addremovetools-nologintext: You will need to log in to Toolhub to add or remove tools
addremovetools-summary: Tool developers submit a URL to a toolinfo.json file consisting of information about their tools in a JSON file format. This file is accessible on the web and adheres to a version 1.2.0 schema. We encourage tool developers to host their files in a git repository so that other volunteers can submit pull requests to it. Toolhub will then crawl the tool records from it and add them to the catalog. In the future, Toolhub will allow its users to submit their tools directly via the interface.
appnamecharslimit: App name must be less than 255 characters
auditlogs-pagetitle: This page lists all log entries
author: Author
charslimit: Chars must be less than $1 characters
charsrange: Chars need to be in the range: $1
crawlerhistory-pagesubtitle: This page lists all historic crawler runs
developersettings-appregistersuccesstext: Success! '$1' app registered. Make sure to copy your client secret now. You won’t be able to see it again.
developersettings-appupdateerror: An error occurred while updating the app with client id '$1'
developersettings-noauthorizedappsfoundt: You have not authorized any client apps to use your account
developersettings-nologintext: You will need to log in to Toolhub to view authorized apps
developersettings-pagesubtitle: View, register, authorize and revoke oauth applications
members-dialog-title: Add or remove user '$1' from groups
members-pagetitle: This page lists all members, groups they are in, and features for adding or remove users from groups. Members with special permissions will have access to the features and need to log in to use them.
metadata-addremovetools-description: Visit this page to add or remove tools directly via the interface or a JSON file url.
metadata-apidocs-description: Visit this page to learn about the Toolhub API and how to use various endpoints to access the supported features.
metadata-auditlogs-description: Visit this page to view recent changes: when a user joined, a tool was added, removed, etc.
metadata-crawlerhistory-description: Visit this page to view crawler history: an analysis of the URLs crawled and tools added by Toolhub.
metadata-developersettings-description: Visit this page to view, register, authorize and revoke oauth applications.
metadata-edittool-description: Visit this page to edit the tool
metadata-home-description: Toolhub is an authoritative and well promoted catalog of Wikimedia tools. Learn more about 500+ tools currently available.
metadata-revisionsdiff-description: Visit this page to view differences between revisions of the tool
metadata-search-description: Visit this page to view search results for the query
metadata-toolhistory-description: Visit this page to view history of the tool
metadata-toolview-description: Visit this page to view additional information about the tool: tool’s type, wikis it is available for, technology used, etc.
name: Name
nourlsfounderror: No toolinfo.json file URL(s) found in the Toolhub system.
tagline-about: An authoritative and well promoted catalog of Wikimedia tools.
tagline-learnmore: Learn more about Toolhub on metawiki
title: Title
toolicon-pattern-regex: Tool icon must be a link to a Wikimedia Commons file description page.
tooltitle-pattern-regex: Tool title must contain only letters, numbers and dashes.
tooluilangs-pattern-regex: Language should use ISO 639 codes like `zh` and `scn`
toolforwikis-pattern-regex: Use hostnames such as `zh.wiktionary.org`. Use asterisks as wildcards. For example, '*.wikisource.org' means 'this tool works on all Wikisource wikis.'
tool-deprecated-error: This tool is not recommended for use.
tool-experimental-error: This tool is experimental! It is unstable and can change or become unavailable at any time.
tool-replacement-link: Try link to a replacement tool: $1.
urlcharslimit: URL must be less than 255 characters
viewrevisionsdiff: View difference between revisions of tool $1
